content.title: Venous Valve Function
content.definition: Venous valves are bicuspid intimal folds that maintain unidirectional blood flow toward the heart, preventing reflux and enabling efficient venous return despite gravitational forces.

distribution.lower_extremity: Most numerous in calf, decreasing proximally
distribution.deep_system: Multiple valves in calf, 1-3 in femoral
distribution.perforators: Direct flow from superficial to deep

normal_function: Reduce hydrostatic pressure on distal veins
Allow muscle pump to propel blood proximally
Close with increased distal pressure (reflux prevention)
valve_cycle: Open: Flow toward heart during muscle contraction
Close: Prevent backflow during muscle relaxation

learning_objectives: Describe venous valve structure and distribution
Explain valve function in venous return
Define pathologic reflux duration on duplex
clinical_pearls: Reflux >0.5 sec in superficial veins is pathologic
Terminal valve at SFJ is first line of defense
